page.title: 02 High Gosforth Park
page.content: High Gosforth Park is a large 800 acre estate near Wideopen, which belongs to the H.G.P. Company.We met Mr Smith, the Managing Director of the company, who told us that the company was founded in 1881. The company leases land inside the park to the following organisations,the Golf Centre,Northumberland Golf Club, the Scout Camp, the Caravan Club,the Squash Club,and the Exibition Centre. Woodland in the park is conserved by Northumberland Natural History Society.The majority of the land owned by H.G.P. Company is the Race Course. Mr Smith,the clerk of the course,is responsible for the racing programme. Gosforth Park is probably the main race-track of the North East.The most famous and well known race is the Northumberland Plate.It is sometimes called "the Pitman's Derby".
